verses.verse: The burden<WH4853> of Tyre<WH6865>. Howl<WH3213>, ye ships<WH591> of Tarshish<WH8659>; for it is laid waste<WH7703>, so that there is no house<WH1004>, no entering in<WH935>: from the land<WH776> of Kittim<WH3794> it is revealed to them<WH1540>.
Be still<WH1826>, ye inhabitants<WH3427> of the coast<WH339>, thou whom the merchants<WH5503> of Sidon<WH6721>, that pass over<WH5674> the sea<WH3220>, have replenished<WH4390>.
And on great<WH7227> waters<WH4325> the seed<WH2233> of the Shihor<WH7883>, the harvest<WH7105> of the Nile<WH2975>, was her revenue<WH8393>; and she was the mart<WH5505> of nations<WH1471>.

Be thou ashamed<WH954>, O Sidon<WH6721>; for the sea<WH3220> hath spoken<WH559>, the stronghold<WH4581> of the sea<WH3220>, saying<WH559>, I have not travailed<WH2342>, nor brought forth<WH3205>, neither have I nourished<WH1431> young men<WH970>, nor brought up<WH1431> virgins<WH1330>.
When the report<WH8088> cometh to Egypt<WH4714>, they shall be sorely pained<WH2342> at the report<WH8088> of Tyre<WH6865>.
Pass ye over<WH5674> to Tarshish<WH8659>; wail<WH3213>, ye inhabitants<WH3427> of the coast<WH339>.
Is this your joyous<WH5947> city<WH6927>, whose antiquity is of ancient<WH6924> days<WH3117>, whose feet<WH7272> carried<WH2986> her afar off<WH7350> to sojourn<WH1481>?

Who hath purposed<WH3289> this against Tyre<WH6865>, the bestower of crowns<WH5849>, whose merchants<WH5503> are princes<WH8269>, whose traffickers<WH3667> are the honorable<WH3513> of the earth<WH776>?
Jehovah <WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> hath purposed<WH3289> it<WH2490>, to stain the pride<WH1347> of all glory<WH6643>, to bring into contempt<WH7043> all the honorable<WH3513> of the earth<WH776>.
Pass <WH5674> through thy land<WH776> as the Nile<WH2975>, O daughter<WH1323> of Tarshish<WH8659>; there is no restraint any more<WH4206>.

He hath stretched out<WH5186> his hand<WH3027> over the sea<WH3220>, he hath shaken<WH7264> the kingdoms<WH4467>: Jehovah<WH3068> hath given commandment<WH6680> concerning Canaan<WH3667>, to destroy<WH8045> the strongholds<WH4581> thereof<WH4581>.

And he said<WH559>, Thou shalt no more<WH3254> rejoice<WH5937>, O thou oppressed<WH6231> virgin<WH1330> daughter<WH1323> of Sidon<WH6721>: arise<WH6965>, pass over<WH5674> to Kittim<WH3794>; even there shalt thou have no rest<WH5117>.

Behold <WH776>, the land of the Chaldeans<WH3778>: this people<WH5971> was not<WH804>; the Assyrian founded<WH3245> it for them that dwell in the wilderness<WH6728>; they set up<WH6965> their towers<WH971>; they overthrew<WH6209> the palaces<WH759> thereof<WH7760>; they made it a ruin<WH4654>.
Howl <WH3213>, ye ships<WH591> of Tarshish<WH8659>; for your stronghold<WH4581> is laid waste<WH7703>.

And it shall come to pass in that day<WH3117>, that Tyre<WH6865> shall be forgotten<WH7911> seventy<WH7657> years<WH8141>, according to the days<WH3117> of one<WH259> king<WH4428>: after the end<WH7093> of seventy<WH7657> years<WH8141> it shall be unto Tyre<WH6865> as in the song<WH7892> of the harlot<WH2181>.

Take <WH3947> a harp<WH3658>, go about<WH5437> the city<WH5892>, thou harlot<WH2181> that hast been forgotten<WH7911>; make sweet<WH3190> melody<WH5059>, sing many<WH7235> songs<WH7892>, that thou mayest be remembered<WH2142>.

And it shall come to pass after the end<WH7093> of seventy<WH7657> years<WH8141>, that Jehovah<WH3068> will visit<WH6485> Tyre<WH6865>, and she shall return<WH7725> to her hire<WH868>, and shall play the harlot<WH2181> with all the kingdoms<WH4467> of the world<WH776> upon the face<WH6440> of the earth<WH127>.

And her merchandise<WH5504> and her hire<WH868> shall be holiness<WH6944> to Jehovah<WH3068>: it shall not be treasured<WH686> nor laid up<WH2630>; for her merchandise<WH5504> shall be for them that dwell<WH3427> before<WH6440> Jehovah<WH3068>, to eat<WH398> sufficiently<WH7654>, and for durable<WH6266> clothing<WH4374>.
